result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Declined- Order to Quash Defense Subpoenas for Preliminary Hearing - deputy Franco-Vincent

CASES 22CF2, 22TR356. 08:32 AM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Scott Charles Geisen in court with attorney Adam P Nero.  Attorney David Stilin in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. State calls Deputy Neumann - sworn. Atty Nero references State's motion to quash subpoena and the order which hasn't been signed yet, states that subpoena has been served. State objects to arresting officer needing to testify. CT - State's motion to quash is denied. Deputy Atty Nero moves for sequestration. CT denies motion for sequestration. State offers Ex 1 - received. State questions Deputy Neumann. Atty Nero moves for booking photo w/notes being used by witness to be marked. CT - granted. Exhibit 2 marked.CT finds identification is made. State offers Ex 2 - received.  State offers Ex 3 - received. Cross by Atty Nero. Defense calls Deputy Franco Vincent S&T. Atty Nero - would like to question Deputy re: delayed appearance on subpoena. State objects. CT denies Atty Nero's request. Atty Nero objects to bind over. CT finds PC, Def bound over for trial. ARGN: Reading waived, plea NG. Defense intends to file substitution request. Further proceedings to be set once new Judge is assigned. TR to continue to track. Bond cont. 9:27 am adj.
